intro: Vittadinia pustulata, commonly known as the blister grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. The plant has hairy, rough leaves and produces small, hairy fruits that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands and coastal areas. Vittadinia pustulata is a hardy species that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
